item.title: Nicole add a quote by Azar Nafisi
item.description: "Do not, under any circumstances, belittle a work of fiction by trying to turn it into a carbon copy of real life; what we search for in fiction is not so much reality but the epiphany of truth." -- Azar Nafisi

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "Don't join the book burners. Don't think you're going to conceal faults by concealing evidence that they ever existed. Don't be afraid to go in your library and read every book..." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Say not, 'I have found the truth,' but rather, 'I have found a truth.' Say not, ' I have found the path of the soul.' Say rather, 'I have met the soul walking upon my path.' For the soul walks upon all paths. The soul walks not upon a line, neither does it grow like a reed. The soul unfolds itself, like a lotus of countless petals." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Read the best books first, or you may not have a chance to read them at all." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "There is no remedy for love, but to love more." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Robert J. Sawyer
item.description: "Learning to ignore things is one of the great paths to inner peace." -- Robert J. Sawyer

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "But the wild things cried, “Oh please don’t go - we’ll eat you up - we love you so!” And Max said, “No!” The wild things roared their terrible roars and gnashed their terrible teeth and rolled their terrible eyes and showed their terrible claws but Max stepped into his private boat and waved goodbye." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Many a book is like a key to unknown chambers within the castle of one’s own self." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Emily Jane Brontë
item.description: "If all else perished, and he remained, I should still continue to be; and if all else remained, and he were annihilated, the universe would turn to a mighty stranger." -- Emily Jane Brontë

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Real generosity towards the future lies in giving all to the present." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Nicole add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Not knowing when the dawn will come I open every door." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Human speech is like a cracked kettle on which we tap crude rhythms for bears to dance to, while we long to make music that will melt the stars." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Kobayashi Issa
item.description: "What a strange thing! to be alive beneath cherry blossoms." -- Kobayashi Issa

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Hilary Mantel
item.description: "Some of these things are true and some of them lies. But they are all good stories." -- Hilary Mantel

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Margaret Wise Brown
item.description: "Goodnight stars, goodnight air, goodnight noises everywhere." -- Margaret Wise Brown

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description: "I read a book one day and my whole life was changed." -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "A book is really like a lover. It arranges itself in your life in a way that is beautiful." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Ernesto Guevara
item.description: "Many will call me an adventurer, and that I am...only one of a different sort: one who risks his skin to prove his truths." -- Ernesto Guevara

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Charles Eames
item.description: "Eventually everything connects - people, ideas, objects. The quality of the connections is the key to quality per se." -- Charles Eames

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Lucille Clifton
item.description: "may you kiss the wind then turn from it certain that it will love your back" -- Lucille Clifton

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "My little old dog a heart-beat at my feet" -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Nicole add a quote by M.F.K. Fisher
item.description: "Probably one of the most private things in the world is an egg before it is broken." -- M.F.K. Fisher

item.title: Nicole add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?" -- George Bernard Shaw
